The press release from United Union of R: Waterproofers and Allied Workers calling for "repeal or complete reform of President Obama's Affordable Care Act (ACA)" was used as evidence to verify the claim.
The letter sent by three larger unions: including The Teamsters, the United Food and Commercial International Union, and Unite-Here, expressing concerns about the Affordable Care Act, was also employed to verify the claim.
The fact that at least six unions: out of a total of 23 member unions in the National Coordinating Committee for Multiemployer Plans, publicly objected to Obamacare was considered as evidence to support the claim.
The contrasting support for the law from: which represents lower-paid workers, was also taken into account to verify the claim.
